results.title: Dennis O'Rourke: Filmmaker
results.creator_credit: Television and Radio School and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Dennis O’Rourke talks to Peter Thompson about his film “Cannibal Tours”. He discusses moral issues concerning the cultures of Western tourists and the people of Papua New Guinea.

results.title: Denial
results.brief_description: When you’re fourteen and in trouble, confusion builds on confusion. Kane’s secret has become too complicated, too painful, too dangerous, and he can’t begin to stop denying. This award-winning and internationally acclaimed film is a study of some of the difficulties affecting all youth growing up in the 90’s.

results.title: Deliverance (Special edition) (D)
results.creator_credit: John Boorman, Elmer Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The story of four ordinary men who embark on a canoe trip in the backwoods of America, determined to test themselves against a wilderness they only think they understand. Jon Voight, Burt Reynolds, Ned Beatty and Ronny Cox play the four friends whose three-dimensional roles heighten the film’s impact and broader significance. Director John Boorman, renowned for his mastery of visual beauty and compelling mystery, maintains a narrative tension that never falters. The film is like a phantom; its images linger in our minds long after the river slows and returns us to real life. Screenplay by James Dickey, based upon his novel. This special edition contains a behind the scenes documentary, “The Dangerous world of ‘Deliverance’” and the original theatrical trailer, both of which appear before the feature.

results.title: Panama Canal: the mountain and the mosquito
results.creator_credit: Richard D'Alessio, Christopher Rowley, Jane Armstrong and National Geographic Television
results.brief_description: This National Geographic documentary uses rare archival footage together with re-enactments to tell the story of the construction of the Panama Canal. Driven by both military and economic imperatives, U.S President Theodore Roosevelt pushed this project which would link the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. He appointed railroad and civil engineer John Stevens to lead the massive engineering endeavour. Appalled by the poor health and low morale under which earlier crews had laboured in the project, Stevens improved conditions and accommodation for the 24,000 construction workers. He was assisted by physician William Crawford Gorgas, who brought under control the tropical diseases of malaria and yellow fever. After 7 years of evacuation and construction, a lock system was established across the isthmus which opened in 1914.

results.title: Panama
results.creator_credit: Ernest Troost, Egenolf Jeske, Klemens Jeske and Arbeitsgruppe Medienverband
results.brief_description: Based on the book “Oh, wie schon Ist Panama” by Janosch. Published in the US under the title “The trip to Panama”. English version by Judy Duris. Little Bear and Little Tiger are two friends who abandon their happy home to search for Panama - ‘the land of our dreams’- only to return to the place from which they came. A subtle treatment of the theme of appreciating what you already have.

results.title: Delia Smith's winter collection. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Twelve episodes filled with warm recipes for winter food by well-known culinary expert Delia Smith. Filmed from her home kitchen in Suffolk, Delia prepares a veritable feast of soups, starters, casseroles, seafood, roasts, poultry and desserts as well as winter baking. This program will undoubtedly get the mouth watering and the most reluctant cook back in the kitchen.

results.title: Palooka
results.creator_credit: Benjamin Stoloff, Edward Small, Reliance Pictures and Edward Small Productions
results.brief_description: Raw comedy drama based on Ham Fisher’s famous comic strip. Jimmy Durante plays the sometimes obnoxious and sleazy boxing manager Knobby Walsh as he goes about trying to exploit his up and coming protogee, the young and naive Joe Palooka (Stuart Erwin) to figh tthe current champion, Al McSwatt (played by James Cagney’s look alike brother, William Cagney). Also stars Lupe Velez, Marjorie Rambeau, Robert Armstrong and Mary Carlisle.

results.title: Defense de Savoir = Forbidden to Know
results.brief_description:
Maitre Laube is a humble lawyer who is called on to the defense of Simone, a prostitute accused of murdering her lover. The lover was actually killed during a holdup, and was a member of a gang which did bullying favors for local politicians. Faced with Simone’s refusal to cooperate, Laube is left alone to unravel a much more complicated plot than he anticipated.

Credits: Producer, Raymond Danon ; director, Nadine Marquand Trintignant ; writers, Alain Corneau, Nadine Trintignant ; photography, William Lubtchansky ; music, Bruno Nicolai.
Cast: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Michel Bouquet, Bernadette Lafont, Juliet Berto, Claude Pieplu, Charles Denner, Barbara Laage, Serge Marquand, Marie Trintignant.

results.title: Palette of glass
results.brief_description: Shows the creation of a set of stained glass windows for the Art Institute of Chicago, tracing the project from design to installation. Illustrates the fascinating collaboration between the artist, Marc Chagall, and the glass-maker to produce such wonderful designs. Spoken in English and French (with English subtitles). Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
